title: [Massive] Problem Transformation Instructional Design for Conceptual Linking of Fractional Operations and Integer Arithmetic

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Integer Operations (Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division) and Understanding of Fractional Expressions
context.additional_context: Most learners are teaching credential candidates or job seekers interested in math education, requiring simultaneous theoretical understanding and practical application skills.

learning_goals: Learners can explain structural similarities between fractional operations and integer arithmetic through three or more problem transformation examples
Learners can implement problem-solving strategies applying the same operational principles to fractional/integer contexts with over 80% accuracy
Learners can recognize the "integer bias" phenomenon that hinders conceptual transfer between domains and propose pedagogical approaches to overcome it

resources: LMS platform with automated grading system

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
